item.title: about
item.description:
about

Honza researches Butoh since 2007. He worked with some famous masters like: Itto Morita, Atsushi Takenouchi, Ken Mai, Yumiko Yoshioka, Yuko Ota, Imre Thormann, Iwana Masaki, Rhizome Lee, Yukio Waguri and Natsu Nakajima. He studied at the Himalaya Subbody Butoh School since 2011, and graduated spring 2016 after spending two years full time training.

item.title: What is Butoh?
item.description:
What is Butoh?

You are a computer scientist. How did you get interested in Butoh?

Butoh is a shamanic performance art. It originated in Japan in the 60â€™s as a rebellion against traditional Japanese theater/dance. It was developed by Hijikata and Ohno. Butoh is a word like Jazz: it is difficult to define, but somehow you can learn to recognize it.

item.title: Fragmentation live at the Royal Conservatory, Den Haag 2/2/2012
item.description:
Fragmentation live at the Royal Conservatory, Den Haag 2/2/2012

"Post-Modern Fragmentation" Honza Svasek, the butoh dancer, controls sound and visuals using his brainwaves. Alberto Novello: concept, game programming, data visuals, music, real-time scientific analysis. Emmanuel Elias Flores, frontal visuals

item.title: Recycled in Death - Amsterdam Fringe Festival - Sept 2016
item.description:
Recycled in Death - Amsterdam Fringe Festival - Sept 2016

Choreography: Honza Svasek. Performance: Philemon Mukarno & AgA Wi
